details.title: Toss delayed
details.content: Trent Bridge received torrential rain in the past two days leaving the outfield wet. Although the umpires visited the field, it is almost certain that the toss will be delayed.

details.title: Covers back on
details.content:
An inspection was scheduled for 3 pm IST but was put off after it started raining again.

Well, the rain has got heavier and the covers are on #CWC19 pic.twitter.com/8WYSK1Or4J

— BCCI (@BCCI) June 13, 2019

details.title: WATCH | Can Vijay Shankar or Dinesh Karthik fill Shikhar Dhawan's shoes against Kiwis?
What happens if match gets washed out?
details.content: If the fixture gets washed out and both teams are forced to split points, it will affect the Men in Blue more than Kane Williamson's team. CLICK HERE to find out why.

details.title: Inspection postponed
details.content: The next inspection will be carried out at around 4:00 pm IST. All the covers bar the main hover cover, have been taken off.

details.title: Harsha tweets
details.content:
Oh dear! Was looking good and here comes the drizzle again. Big issue here is even if stops there is neither sunlight nor a breeze to dry the outfield. Also, the covers cover the square and not the entire ground.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) June 13, 2019

details.title: Covers back on
details.content:
Raining intensifies after in Nottingham after a small break

Covers back on! Or is that a hovercraft?! Next inspection is due at 10:30pm (NZT) 🏏
📱| https://t.co/aU5ayqheAz #CWC19  #BACKTHEBLACKCAPS pic.twitter.com/v16dsY1SOp

— BLACKCAPS (@BLACKCAPS) June 13, 2019

details.title: Covers off
details.content: Minutes before the inspection, covers are removed as raining stops.

details.title: Anxious moments
details.content: Indian fans shelter from the rain at Trent Bridge (AP Photo)

details.title: Inspection at 5:00 pm IST
details.content:
UPDATE - It's a waiting game here as the next inspection will take place at 12.30 PM local time #CWC19 pic.twitter.com/kyBdwgyjOp

— BCCI (@BCCI) June 13, 2019

details.title: Good news for fans
details.content: With a wet spell forecast all over England for the remainder of this week, this tally can still grow. The only consolation for fans is, they will get a full refund if a match is washed out without a ball bowled. CLICK HERE to read full story.

details.title: Kiwis on the field
details.content:
🤔 Will we, won't we?! Next inspection at 12:30pm local time (11:30pm NZT) 🏏 Covers on at present...
📱| https://t.co/aU5ayqheAz #CWC19 #BACKTHEBLACKCAPS #KaneWilliamson @PhotosportNZ pic.twitter.com/rYupxuFmhQ

— BLACKCAPS (@BLACKCAPS) June 13, 2019

details.title: Covers back on
details.content:
It's still drizzling in Nottingham and the next inspection will be at 12:30PM.

Follow #INDvNZ blog for live updates 👇https://t.co/sbKb0rLYkL pic.twitter.com/u34154Pgl0

— Cricket World Cup (@cricketworldcup) June 13, 2019

details.title: It's raining again at Trent Bridge
details.content:
Next inspection at 6:00 pm IST

Covers are back on as it has started to drizzle again 😑#CWC19 pic.twitter.com/N5B09s3reh

— BCCI (@BCCI) June 13, 2019

details.title: Express @WC
details.content:
Rain can't keep the India fan away from Trent Bridge #WorldCup2019 #IndvsNZ pic.twitter.com/YMKXDRpJk6

— atreyo mukhopadhyay (@atreyom) June 13, 2019

details.title: Kedar's plea
details.content: A video of Indian all-rounder Kedar Jhadav pleading rain to go to drought-hit Maharashtra instead of delaying the match has gone viral. CLICK HERE to watch.

details.title: Harbhajan tweets
details.content:
Bad news raining heavily in Nottingham.. No cricket 🏏 pic.twitter.com/6PdUWVIIlF

— Harbhajan Turbanator (@harbhajan_singh) June 13, 2019

details.title: Lunch time!
details.content: Players and support staff of both sides will have lunch now. This means the match will have a shorter mid-innings break.

details.title: WATCH | Dada hails John Wright
details.content:
"He was more of a friend than a coach to me"

Former India skipper @SGanguly99 relives the glory days with his "favourite coach" John Wright. pic.twitter.com/uGATBe5Zwh

— Cricket World Cup (@cricketworldcup) June 13, 2019

details.title: Rain tops the table!
details.content: With rain playing spoilsport in three of the World Cup 2019 games already, fans have started taking potshots at the tournament with one topping it all by putting rain in pole position on the points table. CLICK HERE to read full story
